title: Job Openings at HR leverage Africa
content:
HR leverage Africa is a pan- Africa workforce management company with presence in over 7 Africa countries specialising in delivery of customized HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Shift Engineer, Cane Milling

Job Location: Niger

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Supervise and coordinate milling operations during the shift to ensure smooth cane crushing and juice extraction.
	Monitor equipment performance, identify abnormalities, and take corrective actions promptly.
	Ensure compliance with production targets, efficiency levels, and quality standards.
	Coordinate preventive and corrective maintenance activities with the engineering/maintenance team.
	Lead, supervise, and motivate operators, fitters, and technicians on shift.
	Maintain proper logbooks, shift reports, and records of operational parameters.
	Troubleshoot mechanical, hydraulic, and process-related issues in milling plants.
	Enforce adherence to safety regulations, environmental standards, and good manufacturing practices.
	Communicate effectively with incoming/outgoing shifts and other departments to ensure continuity of operations.
	Partic


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree / Higher National Diploma in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or related field.
	3 – 5 years of experience in sugar factory operations, preferably in cane milling.
	Strong knowledge of cane preparation, milling tandems, juice extraction, and related process equipment.
	Familiarity with preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, and shift management.
	Good leadership and supervisory skills with the ability to manage shift teams.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a high-temperature industrial environment.
	Upate in process optimization initiatives and recommend improvements for increased efficiency.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ogohjohn92@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Project Accountant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Responsibilities


	Prepare, monitor, and control project budgets, forecasts, and expenditure.
	Track, analyze, and report on project financial performance, including cost variances, commitments, and projections.
	Ensure accurate and timely posting of project-related transactions in the accounting system.
	Review and validate project invoices, contracts, and purchase orders for compliance.
	Prepare financial reports for management, project stakeholders, and auditors.
	Monitor cash flow requirements for ongoing projects.
	Assist project managers in understanding financial data and implications of decisions.
	Support the preparation of project audits and compliance reviews.
	Ensure adherence to company policies, accounting principles, and regulatory standards.
	Identify financial risks and recommend corrective actions.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Professional qualification such as ACA, ACCA, or equivalent is an advantage).
	3–5 years of relevant experience in project accounting, management accounting, or financial control.
	Strong knowledge of project costing, financial reporting, and budgeting processes.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., SAP, QuickBooks, or ERP systems) and MS Excel.
	Strong analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work under tight deadlines.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with project teams, contractors, and stakeholders.


Additional Requirements:


	Experience in construction, engineering, or manufacturing projects is an added advantage.
	High level of integrity and professional ethics.


Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ogohjohn92@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Concrete Supervisor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Key Responsibilities


	Supervise all aspects of concrete work, including formwork, reinforcement, mixing, pouring, finishing, and curing.
	Ensure concrete operations comply with engineering drawings, specifications, and quality standards.
	Coordinate manpower, equipment, and materials required for concrete activities.
	Monitor and control concrete placement to achieve correct levels, alignment, and finishes.
	Inspect formwork, reinforcement, and embedded items before concrete pouring.
	Liaise with batching plant, quality control, and site engineers to ensure timely delivery and quality of concrete.
	Maintain accurate records of work done, materials used, and labor productivity.
	Enforce strict adherence to safety regulations and safe work practices.
	Provide leadership and guidance to concrete workers, masons, and subcontractors.
	Report daily progress, challenges, and resource requirements to site management.
	Identify and resolve technical or on-site issues related to concrete works.


Qualifications and Skills


	Diploma / Certificate in Civil Engineering, Construction Technology, or related field.
	3 - 5 years of experience supervising concrete works on construction projects.
	Strong knowledge of concrete technology, mix designs, curing methods, and quality control procedures.
	Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and specifications.
	Excellent leadership and team management skills.
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Good communication and reporting skills.
	Commitment to safety, quality, and efficiency.


Additional Requirements:


	Ability to work long hours and under site conditions.
	Familiarity with concrete testing and standards is an added advantage.


Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ogohjohn92@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

4.) Workshop Officer (Auto-Electrician)

Job Location: Niger

Responsibilites


	Diagnose electrical faults in vehicles, trucks, tractors, and heavy equipment.
	Repair and maintain wiring harnesses, lighting systems, ignition systems, alternators, starter motors, and other electrical components.
	Install and test electrical and electronic devices such as batteries, alarms, radios, air-conditioning systems, GPS trackers, and sensors.
	Inspect, service, and replace faulty wiring and electrical parts.
	Use diagnostic tools, meters, and schematics to identify and troubleshoot electrical issues.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards and company maintenance procedures.
	Keep accurate records of work performed, materials used, and parts replaced.
	Support preventive and corrective maintenance programs to reduce equipment downtime.
	Collaborate with mechanics, technicians, and operators to ensure effective repairs and service delivery.
	Maintain workshop tools, equipment, and ensure a clean, safe work environment.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Eng Degree with 2 years of work experience.


Application Closing Date: 8th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ogohjohn92@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Shulifang Biotechnology
content:
Shulifang Biotechnology is a Chinese company located in the lekki free zone Lagos Nigeria. which produces and manages household daily necessities, such as dishwashing liquid, powder detergent, edible oil, etc

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Area Sales Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Strong leadership and team management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Strategic thinking and analytical skills
	Negotiation and sales skills
	Familiarity with CRM software and sales automation tools
	Personal Qualities:
	Results-driven and motivated
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
	Strong problem-solving and adaptability skills
	Customer-focused and enthusiastic.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree or HND qualification with 3 - 6 years of relevant work experience.
	Must be above 40 years.


Salary
N200,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 28th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nigeriaslf.btf@gmal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Sales Officer (Vegetable Oil / Soybean Oil and Shower Gel - Body Wash)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We're a leading manufacturer / distributor of high-quality vegetable oils, including soybean oil. We're seeking an experienced Sales Executive to drive sales growth and expand our customer base.
	The Sales Executive will operate in the entire cities in Lagos.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve targets.
	Build and maintain relationships with existing and potential customers.
	Identify new business opportunities and expand customer base.
	Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends.
	Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless customer experience.


Requirements


	2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in the FMCG / food industry.
	Strong communication and negotiation skills.
	Ability to work independently and meet sales targets.


What We Offer


	Salary: N120,000 - N150,000 monthly and commission structure.
	Opportunity to work with a leading brand.
	Professional growth and development opportunities.
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment.


Application Closing Date: 18th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: nigeriaslf.btf@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Candidates should indicate the cities they want to work in and the product they want to market in mail.

 

 

3.) Shaving Stick Marketer

Job Locations: Calabar - Cross River, Uyo - Akwa Ibom, Jos - Plateau, and Sokoto
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Product promotion: Will promote products to increase sales and brand awareness.
	Market research: Will be selling directly to the retailers.
	Product placement: Willensure that products are displayed attractively and prominently in stores..
	Brand representation: They represent the brand and maintain its image in the market.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / BSc Degree with 3 - 5 years of experience.


Skills Required:


	Communication skills: Must have the skill to communicate effectively with customers, colleagues, and suppliers.
	Analytical skills: Must have the ability to analyse sales data, consumer behaviour, and market trends.


What We Offer


	Salary: N150,000 / month.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development in a dynamic and innovative company
	Collaborative and supportive team environment.
	Commission on the total sales per month.


Application Closing Date: 10th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: nigeriaslf.btf@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Operations lead Job at Future Moves Recruitment Agency
content:
Future Moves Recruitment Agency is a licensed full-fledged Human Resource firm with extensive expertise and experience in human Capital development and staffing. Future Moves has exceptional expertise in Talent Sourcing, learning & development, talent management, HR Outsourcing & Payrolling, HR planning & Consulting, Policy Drafting, Culture Change and Organisation Effectiveness by designing and implementing interventions which identify the core areas of development to enhance the overall growth and competitiveness of your organization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations lead
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Gbagada Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: One Day On, One Day Off
Working Hours: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Industry: Food / FMCG / Hospitality

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Operations Lead to oversee daily activities in a food-based business.
	The ideal candidate must have solid experience in food service operations, FMCG, or hospitality, with strong leadership and coordination abilities.
	She must live within proximity to Gbagada Phase 1 for easy commuting.


Responsibilities


	Supervise day-to-day operations to ensure efficiency and quality standards.
	Oversee production, inventory, and order fulfillment processes.
	Coordinate and manage kitchen, production, or service teams.
	Ensure hygiene, safety, and compliance standards are strictly followed.
	Monitor staff performance and enforce operational procedures.
	Resolve operational challenges promptly and effectively.
	Support cost control, stock management, and vendor coordination.
	Collaborate with management to improve workflow and customer satisfaction.
	Track performance metrics and provide regular reports.


Requirements


	Experience: Minimum 3 – 5 years in a food production company, FMCG, food service, hospitality or hotel kitchen.
	Proven experience in supervising operations or leading teams.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Ability to work efficiently under pressure.
	Good communication and leadership abilities.


Compensation


	N180,000 Monthly + Performance Bonus.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: L.recruiter@fmragency.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
